description: [Vanguard] South Africa's Minister of Sports, Arts, and Culture, Gayton McKenzie, has declared that he does not want the Super Eagles of Nigeria to qualify for the 2026 FIFA World Cup.
title: Africa: I Wish Nigeria Won't Qualify for 2026 World Cup - South Africa Minister

description: [SNA] - Speaking at a session on Sudan during the Aswan Forum for Peace and Sustainable Development, Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation, Ambassador Mohy-Eddin Salim, affirmed Sudan's appreciation for Egypt's efforts in supporting Sudan's security and stability, and in enhancing efforts to strengthen the institutions of the national state, including the armed forces.
title: Africa: Foreign Minister - Egypt Remains a Source of Hope for Stable and Prosperous Continent

description: [This Day] In Lagos, Africa's bustling fashion capital, a new kind of creative revolution just launched. The Ananse Centre for Design is not just another training hub, it is a bold experiment in transforming African creativity into a global enterprise, writes Sunday Ehigiator
title: Africa: How Ananse Is Stitching Africa's Fashion Dreams Into Global Reality

description: [ISS] Terror groups have rebounded after past leadership losses, so Lake Chad Basin security forces cannot afford complacency.
title: Africa: Time to Double Down After Security Strikes Against Boko Haram Leaders

description: [Nile Post] As global attention increasingly shifts toward Africa's demographic and economic rise, South Africa prepares to take center stage by hosting the G20 Leaders' Summit on November 22-23, 2025.
title: Africa: G20 South Africa Poised to Catalyze Industrial, Creative, and Trade Transformation Across the African Continent

description: [allAfrica] Across the world, countries are racing to become ''smoke-free'', and some have already made remarkable progress. Sweden, for example, recently announced that only around 4.5% of its population still smoke cigarettes -- the lowest reported rate in Europe.
title: Africa: Africa's Voice in Tobacco Control - Imported solutions and policies don't fit Africa's needs

description: [Leadership] eHealth Africa (eHA) has joined global health leaders, policymakers and partners at the International Conference on Primary Health Care (ICPHC 2025) in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, to drive conversations on digital transformation, public health infrastructure sustainability, renewable energy for better healthcare delivery and health system resilience across Africa.
title: Africa: Ehealth Africa, Others Make Case for Emergency Operation Centres

description: [Leadership] A renowned development expert, Dr Otive Igbuzor, has identified quality of leadership, effective governance and the strength of institutions as essential factors for the progress of African nations.
title: Africa: 'Quality Leadership, Effective Governance, Key to Africa's Development'

description: [Daily Trust] Governor Dauda Lawal of Zamfara State has said that Africa is not in search of charity but genuine collaboration founded on mutual respect, fairness, and shared values.
title: Africa: Africa Needs Genuine Collaboration, Not Charity - - Gov Lawal

description: [Vanguard] Washington -- Chairman, United Bank for Africa, UBA PLC and Founder, Tony Elumelu Foundation, Mr. Tony Elumelu, in this interview, spoke on highlights of his presentation during the seminar on Boosting Productivity Growth in the Digital Age held at the ongoing annual meetings of the World Bank and International Monetary Fund, IMF, in Washington DC.
title: Africa: Africa Must Be Included in Global Digital, AI Revolution - - Elumelu

description: [Nigeria Health Watch] For decades, media coverage of Africa has been dominated by a narrow and often negative lens, focusing largely on poverty, hunger, corruption, and conflict. While these issues exist, they have too often overshadowed the continent's diverse realities and thriving innovations. According to Africa No Filter, Africa loses up to $4.2 billion annually due to unrepresentative negative media narratives, an amount that could fund the education of over 12 million African children. Beyond the economic loss, such
title: Africa: Nigeria Health Watch to Host the First Solutions Journalism Africa Summit

description: [Radio Dalsan] Somalia's Ambassador to Tanzania and the East Africa Community, Ilyas Ali Hassan, arrived in Kinshasa on Sunday for a high-level working visit.
title: East Africa: Somalia's Ambassador to Tanzania and the East Africa Community Undertakes High-Level Visit to Kinshasa

description: [PMNCH] Snap survey conducted by PMNCH reveals global funding crisis threatening health and rights programs for women, children, and adolescents.
title: Africa: PMNCH Survey Uncovers Global Funding Crisis for Women's, Children's &amp; Adolescents' Health

description: [allAfrica]
title: Africa: All of Africa Today - October 20, 2025

description: [WHO-AFRO] Bulape -- The last Ebola patient in the Democratic Republic of the Congo was discharged today, marking an important milestone in the efforts to end the outbreak. The recovery kicks off a 42-day countdown to declaring the outbreak over if no further cases are confirmed.
title: Africa: Last Ebola Patient in Democratic Republic of the Congo Discharged

description: [Shabelle] Mogadishu, Oct 19 -- Somali legislator Abdirahman Abdishakur Warsame has issued a stern warning to governments across Africa attempting to stifle youth-led protests, saying such efforts will not halt the growing wave of demands for political change.
title: Africa: Gen Z Youth Driving Unstoppable Wave of Political Change Across Africa, Somali MP Says

description: [SAnews.gov.za] Deputy President Paul Mashatile has pledged that South Africa's Presidency of the Group of 20 (G20) will drive a strong Global South agenda focused on debt relief, inclusive growth, and sustainable development.
title: Africa: South Africa Uses G20 Presidency to Champion Global South and Debt Relief

description: [WHO] The World Bank Group, the Government of Japan, and the World Health Organization officially launched the Health Works Leaders Coalition. This global alliance brings together health and finance ministers, philanthropic organizations, business leaders, leaders of global health agencies, and civil society representatives with the aim of promoting investments in health systems as a strategy for economic growth, job creation, and improved resilience.
title: Africa: Health Works Leaders Coalition Launched to Promote Health System Investments and Spur Economic Growth, Job Creation

description: [New Times] Did you know that one day you could wake up feeling perfectly fine, only to collapse later from a silent heart attack or stroke? These two and other non-communicable diseases (NDCs) are the leading cause of death in the East African region and globally. Hence the call for more political will for the nations to address the health burden.
title: East Africa: Political Will Key to Tackling NCDs in East Africa, Say Health Experts

description: [ENA] Addis Ababa -- The African Union (AU) is calling on communities across the continent to prioritize holistic well-being, including economic security, social harmony, and health literacy, as the critical strategy for preventing Africa's growing mental health crisis.
title: Africa: AU Urges African Communities to Embrace Communal Values for Mental Health

description: [Afropop] If you've ever seen a life-changing concert of music from a far-flung place around the globe in New York City, there's a good chance it was produced by the World Music Institute. On Thursday, October 16, WMI celebrated 40 years of tireless work to bring the very best of global music to New Yorkers. Through wars, recessions, a pandemic, and now a government hostile to the arts in general and foreign culture in specific, WMI has endured.
title: Africa: New York City's World Music Institute Celebrates 40 Years!

description: [CFR] The United States' hastily established third country deportation deals are chaotic and counterproductive.
title: Africa: Transactionalism Tested

description: [African Arguments] The authorities of the Democratic Republic of Congo and the M23 rebels, who control large swathes of Congolese territory, are locked in a new standoff over the delivery of migration documents.
title: Africa: Crisis in Eastern DR Congo - the Congolese Govt and M23 Rebels in a Standoff Over Migration

description: [The Conversation Africa] Minerals such as cobalt, copper, lithium, tantalum, tin and tungsten, which are all abundant in central Africa, are essential to the comforts of everyday life. Our phones, laptops and electric vehicles would not function without them.
title: Africa: How 'Conflict-Free' Minerals Are Used in the Waging of Modern Wars
